overview:
## Overview

You don’t instantiate [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall] objects directly. Instead, [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall] objects are created by the telephony provider when an incoming call is received or an outgoing call is initiated.

Each [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall] object is uniquely identified by a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall/uuid]. You primarily interact with calls by passing their unique identifiers to CallKit APIs. For example, to place a call on hold, you create an instance of [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXSetHeldCallAction] with [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXSetHeldCallAction/init(call:onHold:)] passing the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall/uuid] of the call and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], create a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXTransaction] object containing the action, and then pass the transaction to an instance of [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController] using the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController/request(_:completion:)] method.

You can use the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver] managed by a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController] to access [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall] instances for active calls using the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver/calls] property, or provide an object conforming to the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserverDelegate] protocol to be notified anytime a call is updated.

# CXCall

**Class**

A telephony call.

## Declaration

```swift
class CXCall
```

## Overview

You don’t instantiate [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall] objects directly. Instead, [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall] objects are created by the telephony provider when an incoming call is received or an outgoing call is initiated.

Each [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall] object is uniquely identified by a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall/uuid]. You primarily interact with calls by passing their unique identifiers to CallKit APIs. For example, to place a call on hold, you create an instance of [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXSetHeldCallAction] with [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXSetHeldCallAction/init(call:onHold:)] passing the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall/uuid] of the call and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], create a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXTransaction] object containing the action, and then pass the transaction to an instance of [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController] using the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController/request(_:completion:)] method.

You can use the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver] managed by a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController] to access [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCall] instances for active calls using the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver/calls] property, or provide an object conforming to the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserverDelegate] protocol to be notified anytime a call is updated.

## Accessing Call Attributes

- **uuid**: The unique identifier for the call.
- **isOutgoing**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the call is outgoing.
- **hasConnected**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the call has connected.
- **hasEnded**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the call has ended.
- **isOnHold**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the call is on hold.

## Call information

- **CXCallObserver**: A programmatic interface for an object that manages a list of active calls and observes call changes.
- **CXCallObserverDelegate**: A collection of methods the system calls when a call changes state.
- **CXHandle**: A way to reach a call recipient, such as a phone number or email address.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
